title: GPU at high temps after upgrading to Windows 10
body:
My GPU is at 73~ C at the lowest setting possible excluding 1440x900 res after upgrading to windows 10. Before I upgraded to W10 I had Windows 8 and the GPU would only be at Sub 41 C at 40 percent fan speed. Now I have mine at 70% and it still at such a high temp. On CSGO it would be around 64~ C at med settings and lower fan speed.

Any ideas why it's so high? Is there random stuff that windows 10 runs in the back that I should be aware of?

replies.body: There are a couple of reasons why your PC could be running under such thermal stress, although an OS upgrade is extremely unlikely to be one of them. We made a video going over reducing heat on our youtube channel, which [you can find here.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EFrZbViFqf8) Give those steps a go, and if you still see issues, let me know.
I was being an idiot and forgot to update all my drivers after upgrading to windows 10. The video did remind me to dust out the inside of my desktop! thanks.

1. Open your Task Manager and see if there are apps running in the background which you didn't launch.
2. Perform a Disk Cleanup and a Registry Error check. I recommend [CCleaner](http://www.piriform.com/ccleaner) for this.
3. Perform a virus scan to see if there any viruses on your machine. I recommend [Malwarebytes' Antimalware](https://www.malwarebytes.com/ for this. 
4. Reinstall the games. 

After performing these steps, let us know if your machine is still burning up.
